trans-unit.source: Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Provides general guidance for securing SQL Server running in an Azure Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Provides general guidance for securing SQL Server running in an Azure Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: This topic includes overall security guidelines that help establish secure access to SQL Server instances in an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: This topic includes overall security guidelines that help establish secure access to SQL Server instances in an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: However, in order to ensure better protection to your SQL Server database instances in Azure, we recommend that you implement the traditional on-premises security practices in addition to the security best practices for Azure.
trans-unit.target: However, in order to ensure better protection to your SQL Server database instances in Azure, we recommend that you implement the traditional on-premises security practices in addition to the security best practices for Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the SQL Server security practices, see [SQL Server 2008 R2 Security Best Practices - Operational and Administrative Tasks](http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/2/A/12ABE102-4427-4335-B989-5DA579A4D29D/SQL_Server_2008_R2_Security_Best_Practice_Whitepaper.docx)
trans-unit.target: For more information about the SQL Server security practices, see [SQL Server 2008 R2 Security Best Practices - Operational and Administrative Tasks](http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/2/A/12ABE102-4427-4335-B989-5DA579A4D29D/SQL_Server_2008_R2_Security_Best_Practice_Whitepaper.docx)

trans-unit.source: Azure complies with several industry regulations and standards that can enable you to build a compliant solution with SQL Server running in a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Azure complies with several industry regulations and standards that can enable you to build a compliant solution with SQL Server running in a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For information about regulatory compliance with Azure, see [Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/).
trans-unit.target: For information about regulatory compliance with Azure, see [Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/).

trans-unit.source: Following is a list of security recommendations that should be considered when configuring and connecting to the instance of SQL Server in an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: Following is a list of security recommendations that should be considered when configuring and connecting to the instance of SQL Server in an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: Considerations for managing accounts:
trans-unit.target: Considerations for managing accounts:

trans-unit.source: Create a unique local administrator account that is not named **Administrator**.
trans-unit.target: Create a unique local administrator account that is not named **Administrator**.

trans-unit.source: Use complex strong passwords for all your accounts.
trans-unit.target: Use complex strong passwords for all your accounts.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to create a strong password, see [Create Strong Passwords](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=293596) article in the Safety and Security Center.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to create a strong password, see [Create Strong Passwords](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=293596) article in the Safety and Security Center.

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure selects Windows Authentication during SQL Server Virtual Machine setup.
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure selects Windows Authentication during SQL Server Virtual Machine setup.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the **SA** login is disabled and a password is assigned by setup.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the **SA** login is disabled and a password is assigned by setup.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that the **SA** login should be not be used or enabled.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that the **SA** login should be not be used or enabled.

trans-unit.source: The following are alternative strategies if a SQL Login is desired:
trans-unit.target: The following are alternative strategies if a SQL Login is desired:

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL account that has **CONTROL SERVER** permissions.
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL account that has **CONTROL SERVER** permissions.

trans-unit.source: If you must use a **SA** login, enable the login and rename it and assign a new password.
trans-unit.target: If you must use a **SA** login, enable the login and rename it and assign a new password.

trans-unit.source: Both the options that were mentioned earlier require a change the authentication mode to SQL Server and Windows Authentication Mode.
trans-unit.target: Both the options that were mentioned earlier require a change the authentication mode to SQL Server and Windows Authentication Mode.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Change Server Authentication Mode.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Change Server Authentication Mode.

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL account that has CONTROL SERVER permissions.
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL account that has CONTROL SERVER permissions.

trans-unit.source: If you must use a SA login, enable the login and rename it and assign a new password.
trans-unit.target: If you must use a SA login, enable the login and rename it and assign a new password.

trans-unit.source: Both the options that were mentioned earlier require a change the authentication mode to **SQL Server and Windows Authentication Mode**.
trans-unit.target: Both the options that were mentioned earlier require a change the authentication mode to **SQL Server and Windows Authentication Mode**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Change Server Authentication Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188670.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Change Server Authentication Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188670.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Considerations for Securing Connections to Azure Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: Considerations for Securing Connections to Azure Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: Consider using [Azure Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md) to administer the virtual machines instead of public RDP ports.
trans-unit.target: Consider using [Azure Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md) to administer the virtual machines instead of public RDP ports.

trans-unit.source: Remove any endpoints on the virtual machine if you do not use them.
trans-unit.target: Remove any endpoints on the virtual machine if you do not use them.

trans-unit.source: Enable an encrypted connection option for an instance of the SQL Server Database Engine in Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Enable an encrypted connection option for an instance of the SQL Server Database Engine in Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Configure SQL server instance with a signed certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configure SQL server instance with a signed certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable Encrypted Connections to the Database Engine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191192.aspx) and [Connection String Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms254500.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable Encrypted Connections to the Database Engine](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191192.aspx) and [Connection String Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms254500.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If your virtual machines should be accessed only from a specific network, use Windows Firewall to restrict access to certain IP addresses or network subnets.
trans-unit.target: If your virtual machines should be accessed only from a specific network, use Windows Firewall to restrict access to certain IP addresses or network subnets.

trans-unit.source: You can also consider adding an ACL on your endpoint to restrict traffic only to the clients you permit.
trans-unit.target: You can also consider adding an ACL on your endpoint to restrict traffic only to the clients you permit.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on using ACLs with endpoints, see [Manage the ACL on an endpoint](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md#manage-the-acl-on-an-endpoint)
trans-unit.target: For instructions on using ACLs with endpoints, see [Manage the ACL on an endpoint](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md#manage-the-acl-on-an-endpoint)
